description: After patching one host node in a Server 2022 Hyper-V and StarWind two-node cluster, virtual machines failed to start. The issue was identified when a replicated Cluster Shared Volume (CSV) was incorrectly reported as Master Boot Record (MBR) instead of GUID Partition Table (GPT) in Disk Management. This situation necessitated re-creating the corrupt CSV and restoring the lost virtual machine from backup, highlighting the risk of patching similar clusters without proper precautions, especially in production environments.
